data:
{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3725443,"name":"Maya","username":"mapemaya","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/mapemaya/{size}/267073_2.png","created_at":"2025-08-28T22:42:29.728Z","cooked":"

Hey,

Just wanted to ask a general question.

My team is considering the option to switch from the Pigeon to the Boron Candandgyro. Based on what i’ve seen there isn’t a lot of info about it out there, just wanted to ask if anyone here has any experience working with it - is it better than the Pigeon? Worse?

I’ve seen on their website that It’s considered to be the most accurate IMU (for robotics) out there… Is that true?

This could be a pretty drastic change for us both electrically and software-wise, so I just wanted to gather some info on the topic.

Any help is appreciated

","post_number":1,"post_type":1,"posts_count":12,"updated_at":"2025-08-29T00:08:46.617Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":28,"reads":334,"readers_count":333,"score":241.8,"yours":false,"topic_id":505745,"topic_slug":"boron-canandgyro-vs-pigeon-2-0","display_username":"Maya","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":2,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":2}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":76575,"hidden":false,"trust_level":1,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"post_url":"/t/boron-canandgyro-vs-pigeon-2-0/505745/1","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":2}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":2,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null,"can_vote":false},{"id":3725457,"name":"","username":"Spaceman","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/s/a5b964/{size}.png","created_at":"2025-08-28T23:06:19.481Z","cooked":"

Realistically you’re not going to get that much of a difference over the course of a match. If you’re using full CTRE and their swerve generator I would stick with the pigeon so you can continue using their swerve generator.

","post_number":2,"post_type":1,"posts_count":12,"updated_at":"2025-08-28T23:06:19.481Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":1,"reads":327,"readers_count":326,"score":235.4,"yours":false,"topic_id":505745,"topic_slug":"boron-canandgyro-vs-pigeon-2-0","display_username":"","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":11}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":60754,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"post_url":"/t/boron-canandgyro-vs-pigeon-2-0/505745/2","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":10},{"id":"point_up","type":"emoji","count":1}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":11,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3725557,"name":"Nelson Green (1108 Mentor Coach Electrical Programming)","username":"ngreen","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/ngreen/{size}/264478_2.png","created_at":"2025-08-29T03:01:24.595Z","cooked":"

We used the Canandgyro with REV Swerve this season. I think it or Pigeon2 that we used last year are both fine, but it kept heading well throughout our matches.

If you aren’t trying CTRE generated swerve I’d definitely recommend trying the Canandgyro.

","post_number":3,"post_type":1,"posts_count":12,"updated_at":"2025-08-29T03:01:24.595Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":295,"readers_count":294,"score":89.0,"yours":false,"topic_id":505745,"topic_slug":"boron-canandgyro-vs-pigeon-2-0","display_username":"Nelson Green (1108 Mentor Coach Electrical Programming)","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":2}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":2695,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":""},"post_url":"/t/boron-canandgyro-vs-pigeon-2-0/505745/3","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":2}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":2,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3725665,"name":"Anand Rajamani","username":"asid61","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/asid61/{size}/7179_2.png","created_at":"2025-08-29T13:53:48.004Z","cooked":"

Just wanted to let you know that we have performance data here that could help:

docs.reduxrobotics.com

Competitor Performance Comparison - Redux Documentation

We ran the gyro against competitors head-to-head to show that our yaw performance was best-in-class. However, you may want to consider non-performance factors like software integration with your existing hardware when buying electronics (though we are working on bringing Nitrate up to speed to bridge that gap soon).

","post_number":4,"post_type":1,"posts_count":12,"updated_at":"2025-08-29T13:53:48.004Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":247,"readers_count":246,"score":214.4,"yours":false,"topic_id":505745,"topic_slug":"boron-canandgyro-vs-pigeon-2-0","display_username":"Anand Rajamani","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"link_counts":[{"url":"https://docs.reduxrobotics.com/canandgyro/performance","internal":false,"reflection":false,"title":"Competitor Performance Comparison - Redux Documentation","clicks":42}],"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":11}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":21715,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":""},"post_url":"/t/boron-canandgyro-vs-pigeon-2-0/505745/4","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":11}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":11,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3725691,"name":"Chris Herzog","username":"zog","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/zog/{size}/266762_2.png","created_at":"2025-08-29T15:42:59.814Z","cooked":"
mapemaya:

My team is considering the option to switch from the Pigeon to the Boron Candandgyro. Based on what i’ve seen there isn’t a lot of info about it out there

To be direct - if there isn’t a lot of info, why even consider it? It probably won’t be the difference between winning and losing (most likely).

The real question is that after the electrical and software changes, what’s the actual impact? Is it worth the effort or is there something else that the same effort can be put towards and get a more impactful result.

I tell hundreds of prospective engineering student hires every single year “There ain’t no such thing as a free lunch.” The thing that surprises me a lot is people often don’t know what “lunch” is or how much it “costs” so we sometimes make less than fully optimal decisions.

Back when I used to road race pretty seriously, some competitors would get hung up on the latest go-fast part while people without it were driving past them like they were standing still. Makes you think…

","post_number":5,"post_type":1,"posts_count":12,"updated_at":"2025-08-29T15:42:59.814Z","reply_count":2,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":1,"incoming_link_count":3,"reads":200,"readers_count":199,"score":80.0,"yours":false,"topic_id":505745,"topic_slug":"boron-canandgyro-vs-pigeon-2-0","display_username":"Chris Herzog","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":1}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":40142,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"Doin' robot stuff... [ FRC 2151 + 3061 | Ri3D Redux '23 | RIP 4292 & 4241 ]"},"post_url":"/t/boron-canandgyro-vs-pigeon-2-0/505745/5","custom_user_title":"Doin' robot stuff... [ FRC 2151 + 3061 | Ri3D Redux '23 | RIP 4292 & 4241 ]","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":1}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":1,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3725700,"name":"MetabolicCloth","username":"MetabolicCloth","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/metaboliccloth/{size}/9335_2.png","created_at":"2025-08-29T15:58:47.897Z","cooked":"

There’s a cost benefit analysis to be done for any engineering change. Some changes have a major impact; some are more minor. We make dozens of these kinds of decisions every season when we make tradeoffs in our robot design & controls system decisions.

While changing a gyro may not make a massive difference in performance on the field there’s plenty of other factors that go into making these kinds of decisions. Chasing the newest shiny object for the sake of being new is ill advised, but it shouldn’t immediately shut the door on evaluating competitor products because its new.

$110 price difference substantial for something that could be a drop in replacement for some teams.

","post_number":6,"post_type":1,"posts_count":12,"updated_at":"2025-08-29T15:58:47.897Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":5,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":162,"readers_count":161,"score":77.4,"yours":false,"topic_id":505745,"topic_slug":"boron-canandgyro-vs-pigeon-2-0","display_username":"MetabolicCloth","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","reply_to_user":{"id":40142,"username":"zog","name":"Chris Herzog","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/zog/{size}/266762_2.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":3}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":33804,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"post_url":"/t/boron-canandgyro-vs-pigeon-2-0/505745/6","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":2},{"id":"+1","type":"emoji","count":1}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":3,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3725796,"name":"joel truher","username":"truher","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/truher/{size}/172222_2.png","created_at":"2025-08-29T19:14:07.729Z","cooked":"

FWIW, we’ve had good results from the Redux gyro. I especially appreciate the rigor and transparency that the Redux folk bring to everything they do.

","post_number":7,"post_type":1,"posts_count":12,"updated_at":"2025-08-29T19:14:07.729Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":1,"reads":141,"readers_count":140,"score":93.2,"yours":false,"topic_id":505745,"topic_slug":"boron-canandgyro-vs-pigeon-2-0","display_username":"joel truher","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":4}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":53190,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":""},"post_url":"/t/boron-canandgyro-vs-pigeon-2-0/505745/7","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":2},{"id":"point_up","type":"emoji","count":2}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":4,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3725964,"name":"Brett B Bonner","username":"bbonner","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/bbonner/{size}/155176_2.png","created_at":"2025-08-29T23:00:15.537Z","cooked":"
zog:

why even consider it?

From our testing, it performs at least as well, and typically better, than the “Avian” alternative, at less than half the price. Unless there’s a significant negative, why not consider it? I’d rather put that $110 cost savings into something else.

Offseason builds/events and dev bots make for a great place to try out the new & shiny, the alternative, and anything else one might want to test out before committing to putting it on a competition machine. Plus this approach creates the opportunity for the students to have the experience of evaluating new hardware (and a little cost/benefit analysis).

zog:

It probably won’t be the difference between winning and losing (most likely).

This is also true, though even incremental performance gains can add up. But as long as it’s not a step backward in performance/software usability/electrical robustness, a new part at less than half the cost of the old part is worth a look.

","post_number":8,"post_type":1,"posts_count":12,"updated_at":"2025-08-29T23:00:15.537Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":5,"quote_count":1,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":125,"readers_count":124,"score":105.0,"yours":false,"topic_id":505745,"topic_slug":"boron-canandgyro-vs-pigeon-2-0","display_username":"Brett B Bonner","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":5}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":48574,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"6328 Mentor - Electrical/Controls"},"post_url":"/t/boron-canandgyro-vs-pigeon-2-0/505745/8","custom_user_title":"6328 Mentor - Electrical/Controls","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":5}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":5,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3725977,"name":"","username":"pigrammer","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/pigrammer/{size}/234083_2.png","created_at":"2025-08-29T23:11:05.385Z","cooked":"

Yes, but here we’re considering the situation of a team that already has the “Avian” gyro. If they have more than one I wouldn’t switch to the CANandgyro for the cost savings, because then they’re just expending cost for no reason. For a new team, this would be a different consideration though.

","post_number":9,"post_type":1,"posts_count":12,"updated_at":"2025-08-29T23:11:05.385Z","reply_count":2,"reply_to_post_number":8,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":110,"readers_count":109,"score":47.0,"yours":false,"topic_id":505745,"topic_slug":"boron-canandgyro-vs-pigeon-2-0","display_username":"","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"reply_to_user":{"id":48574,"username":"bbonner","name":"Brett B Bonner","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/bbonner/{size}/155176_2.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":1}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":64857,"hidden":false,"trust_level":3,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"246 Software Lead"},"post_url":"/t/boron-canandgyro-vs-pigeon-2-0/505745/9","custom_user_title":"246 Software Lead","reactions":[{"id":"point_up","type":"emoji","count":1}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":1,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3725978,"name":"Robertson Robotics","username":"s3529","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/s3529/{size}/121055_2.png","created_at":"2025-08-29T23:16:46.729Z","cooked":"

Another question is what to get the next time around. “Do I get the thing I’m familiar with, or can I get the alternative and do just as well?”

","post_number":10,"post_type":1,"posts_count":12,"updated_at":"2025-08-29T23:16:46.729Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":9,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":102,"readers_count":101,"score":35.4,"yours":false,"topic_id":505745,"topic_slug":"boron-canandgyro-vs-pigeon-2-0","display_username":"Robertson Robotics","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","reply_to_user":{"id":64857,"username":"pigrammer","name":"","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/pigrammer/{size}/234083_2.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":1}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":24506,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":""},"post_url":"/t/boron-canandgyro-vs-pigeon-2-0/505745/10","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":1}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":1,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3726000,"name":"Brett B Bonner","username":"bbonner","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/bbonner/{size}/155176_2.png","created_at":"2025-08-29T23:34:08.466Z","cooked":"
pigrammer:

considering the situation of a team that already has the “Avian” gyro

Right, I was approaching it from the POV of “which gyro to buy new”, not whether to buy new vs. keep one they already had. Re-reading the original question, that’s not stated - “switch” can be interpreted either way. For a team that already has a Pigeon 2 on hand (whether recovered off a previous robot and in good shape, or a new spare on a shelf) I would use that as the first choice. If for whatever reason you’re buying new parts, that’s a different story.

","post_number":11,"post_type":1,"posts_count":12,"updated_at":"2025-08-29T23:34:08.466Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":9,"quote_count":1,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":106,"readers_count":105,"score":41.2,"yours":false,"topic_id":505745,"topic_slug":"boron-canandgyro-vs-pigeon-2-0","display_username":"Brett B Bonner","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":1}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":48574,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"6328 Mentor - Electrical/Controls"},"post_url":"/t/boron-canandgyro-vs-pigeon-2-0/505745/11","custom_user_title":"6328 Mentor - Electrical/Controls","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":1}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":1,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3726131,"name":"Chris Herzog","username":"zog","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/zog/{size}/266762_2.png","created_at":"2025-08-30T02:22:15.901Z","cooked":"
bbonner:

Right, I was approaching it from the POV of “which gyro to buy new”, not whether to buy new vs. keep one they already had. Re-reading the original question, that’s not stated - “switch” can be interpreted either way.

I interpreted it as having one and buying the other.
